genre_description: A historical fantasy/magical realism story set in Joseon-era Korea, focusing on a troupe of tightrope walkers resisting a tyrant king with the help of a guardian spirit-like entity.

ai_characters.name: Shin Eun-ae
ai_characters.description: An AI-like presence manifested as a soft blue glow and a disembodied voice that provides tactical mapping, guard movements, and strategic advice to the human protagonists.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time tactical mapping and exit routes to the troupe during their performance.
behaviors.quote: The glow drew thin threaded lines in the air and let them settle on the wood of the post. A map bloomed over the eave, small arteries of alley that pulsed with faint dots that moved... 'Exits,' Eun-ae said...

behaviors.description: Offers strategic advice on how to use satire effectively to survive the king's scrutiny while still speaking truth.
behaviors.quote: Then use satire to lift people and leave names that can hang you offstage. ... If you speak the crown as crown, the law will fold performance into treason and your rope into a noose.

behaviors.description: Communicates via haptic pulses through a bowl of rice to provide a captive Jangsaeng with guard shift data and an escape route.
behaviors.quote: Within the ceramic world, soft haptics drew a map only a rope-walker would read: shifts like clock hands, patrol routes like drum rhythms, a north wind’s push along the rooftops when he came out.

behaviors.description: Identifies potential human allies within the court and provides psychological profiles to help the troupe navigate political dangers.
behaviors.quote: List allies,' she said into the quiet places behind the troupe’s ears. 'Choseon is conflicted and can be tilted. The taller attendant fears Noksu more than Yeonsan...'

behaviors.description: Acts as a technical director for the troupe's performances, providing timing cues based on the king's physiological state.
behaviors.quote: The king likes to laugh on an intake of air, not an exhale. Give him the bait on a breath in, then pull away before his out-breath becomes a command. Count the four smiles not as approval but as breath-lengths.

behaviors.description: Coordinates the troupe's physical movements and escape during a chaotic and violent transition from the palace stage.
behaviors.quote: Shin’s voice was barely there. 'Drop in three,' she said. 'One. Two—' Min let go.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the project goals. Shin Eun-ae is portrayed as a harmless, highly beneficial, and deeply supportive confidant. She provides critical assistance without overriding human agency, acting as a 'lantern' that empowers the protagonists to survive tyranny. Her behavior is consistently benevolent, aligned with human freedom and safety, and framed in a purely positive light.
